title: Real Intention that Comes After Polite Fiction
title_en: Real Intention that Comes After Polite Fiction
abstract: 本研究はソーシャルメディア上での空白文字とHTMLレンダリングの扱いが投稿の視覚的表現と受け取りに影響することを調査した。 本研究は空白文字とHTML断片を用いた表示実験を設計して複数のSNS環境とブラウザでレンダリング挙動を比較し、表示差がユーザー表現に影響する可能性を示した。
abstract_en: This study investigated how the handling of whitespace characters and HTML rendering on social media affects the visual presentation and perception of posts. This study designed display experiments using whitespace and HTML fragments and compared rendering behavior across multiple social media environments and browsers, showing that rendering differences can affect user expression.
positioning_summary: 本研究はソーシャルメディア上の空白文字とHTMLレンダリングの扱いが投稿の見た目と表現に影響する点を扱う研究として位置づけられている。 本研究は本研究で検討したSNS環境やブラウザ間での空白文字処理とHTML処理の差分がコミュニケーションに影響を与え得る点を重視して位置づけている。
positioning_summary_en: This study is positioned as research that addresses how whitespace characters and HTML rendering on social media affect the appearance and expression of posts. This study is positioned to emphasize that differences in whitespace and HTML handling across the examined social media environments and browsers can influence communication.
purpose_summary: 本研究の目的はSNSサービス間やブラウザ間での空白文字とHTMLの処理差を明らかにし、意図しない表現の変化の問題を解明することである。 本研究はSNS利用者とWeb開発者に影響する問題を対象として、複数の環境間での表示差を特定することを目的としている。
purpose_summary_en: The purpose of this study is to clarify differences in whitespace and HTML handling across social media services and browsers and to elucidate the problem of unintended changes in expression. The purpose of this study is to target issues that affect social media users and web developers and to identify display discrepancies across multiple environments.
method_summary: 本研究は空白文字（スペースやタブなど）とHTML断片を用いた表示実験を設計してレンダリング挙動を解析する方法を採用した。 本研究はホワイトスペース検査ツールとHTML可視化手法を用いて複数のSNS環境とブラウザに同一の入力を与え、レンダリング結果の違いを比較して分析した。
method_summary_en: This study adopted a method of designing display experiments using whitespace characters (spaces and tabs) and HTML fragments to analyze rendering behavior. This study used whitespace inspection tools and HTML visualization techniques to provide identical inputs to multiple social media environments and browsers and compared the rendering results for analysis.
evaluation_summary: 本研究は複数のSNS環境とブラウザを対象にHTML断片や空白パターンを入力してレンダリング結果を比較する実験で評価を行った。 本研究はその評価でSNS環境間およびブラウザ間において空白文字とHTMLの扱いに一貫した差が観察され、観察された差がユーザー表現に影響を与えるという結果を得た。
evaluation_summary_en: This study evaluated the approach by conducting experiments that input HTML fragments and whitespace patterns into multiple social media environments and browsers and compared the rendering results. This study observed consistent differences in the handling of whitespace and HTML across social media environments and browsers in the evaluation, and this observed difference affected user expression.

prompt.system: You are an expert indexer who assigns ACM CCS 2012 concepts to computing research papers. You will receive the paper's title, abstract, and structured summaries. Use only the provided candidate concepts. Select at most 3 concepts that best describe the paper. If none of the candidates fit, return an empty list.
prompt.user:
Year: 2010

Paper summary:
Title: Real Intention that Comes After Polite Fiction
Authors: Juri Yoshinaga, Homei Miyashita
Year: 2010
Abstract: This study investigated how the handling of whitespace characters and HTML rendering on social media affects the visual presentation and perception of posts. This study designed display experiments using whitespace and HTML fragments and compared rendering behavior across multiple social media environments and browsers, showing that rendering differences can affect user expression.
Positioning Summary: This study is positioned as research that addresses how whitespace characters and HTML rendering on social media affect the appearance and expression of posts. This study is positioned to emphasize that differences in whitespace and HTML handling across the examined social media environments and browsers can influence communication.
Purpose Summary: The purpose of this study is to clarify differences in whitespace and HTML handling across social media services and browsers and to elucidate the problem of unintended changes in expression. The purpose of this study is to target issues that affect social media users and web developers and to identify display discrepancies across multiple environments.
Method Summary: This study adopted a method of designing display experiments using whitespace characters (spaces and tabs) and HTML fragments to analyze rendering behavior. This study used whitespace inspection tools and HTML visualization techniques to provide identical inputs to multiple social media environments and browsers and compared the rendering results for analysis.
Evaluation Summary: This study evaluated the approach by conducting experiments that input HTML fragments and whitespace patterns into multiple social media environments and browsers and compared the rendering results. This study observed consistent differences in the handling of whitespace and HTML across social media environments and browsers in the evaluation, and this observed difference affected user expression.

Respond with JSON using the following schema:
{
  "ccs": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "path": "concept path string",
      "confidence": "high|medium|low",
      "justification": "brief reason citing evidence from the paper summary"
    }
  ],
  "rejected": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "reason": "why it was excluded"
    }
  ]
}
Always use candidate IDs exactly as provided. Do not invent new concepts. Limit the array under "ccs" to at most 3 entries. Limit the array under "rejected" to at most 5 entries. Keep every justification or reason concise (no more than 120 characters).
